alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 28 at 10:23AM EST until January 30 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM SATURDAY TO 9 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches are expected. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Southeast Webster, Northwest Pocahontas and Southeast Randolph Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 7 AM this morning to 1 AM EST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 4 AM Saturday to 9 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Additional information can be found at https://www.weather.gov/rlx as well as on our Facebook and Twitter pages.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster
